text.p: These are the leading stories in the Kenyan press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Opposition party, FORD-Kenya files an historic motion in parliament -- to pass a vote of no confidence in the government.
- Twenty parliamentarians from western Kenya threaten to take the Electoral Commission to court over irregularities in the voter registration exercise.
- Police dispel rumours circulating in the capital that Kenneth Matiba, chairman of opposition party FORD-Asili has been injured in mysterious circumstances.
- President Daniel arap Moi says the government will set up a commission to review the 8-4-4 system of education.
- A former diplomat Adala Otuko, also chairman of the Luo commumnity of elders, pleads with the president to meet the opposition.
- The government dismisses a report presented by Amnesty International saying it is presumptuous and selective and aims at inciting Kenyans against the government.
